text: today's recipe is inspired by those
delicious Thai coconut soup this one is
a chicken soup with rice noodles I'm
starting off by soaking my rice noodles
with a very hot water this is 6 ounces
of rice noodles which means they're
gluten free you're building lots of
different flavors here with the ginger
and the lime and the jalapeno so you get
spicy and a little bit of sugar for some
sweet it's really really really good and
at the time of year when you're starting
to feel like maybe you've got a cold
make this soup so peel your ginger you
need what's the equivalent of about 2
inches cut it just into slices nice and
thin and you cut across the fibers most
people won't be eating the ginger once
the soup is done but I actually love to
eat big pieces of ginger now I'm using a
whole jalapeno with the seeds because I
want it spicy when I'm getting a cold
there's nothing I like better than to
have a spicy soup but you can remove
them if that's what you want and then
some lime juice you need about 6
tablespoons total so the six tablespoons
is about a third of a cup so that's what
I'm gonna squeeze here so now we're
gonna infuse our broth with the ginger
and the jalapenos I have three and a
half cups of broth in this pot into that
I'm adding my ginger it needs to simmer
to infuse the broth with its labor for
about 10 minutes after 10 minutes you
can add the rest of your ingredients one
can of coconut milk you can use the
low-fat or the regular this is regular
that does make for a rich and delicious
soup once your broth returns to a simmer
you can add in chicken this is 12 ounces
of chicken that's been thinly sliced
cooks right in the broth and because
it's been thinly sliced it shouldn't
take more than about 2 or 3 minutes to
cook through now you can add 3
tablespoons of fish sauce just a hint
light brown sugar I know this isn't
authentic but Thai food is all about the
balance of hot sour or salty and sweet
and you want to make sure that you hit
it right on the nose otherwise not gonna
be delicious
the help in use can go in as well the
lime juice and 1/2 a cup of cilantro by
this point your noodles should be soaked
and softened so you can
them and then they can go right into the
broth as well that's it it's done serve
some up you'll probably need to use
tongs and a ladle for this because well
it's hard to get noodles out of a pot
with a ladle pretty right fantastic and
just what the doctor ordered spicy salty
sour sweet and passiveness oh my gosh I
just love it you guys are gonna
